topic.title: Hot to Protect the PDF file with Permissions

body.p: You can restrict the way people are using the PDF files, by specifying a set of permissions. The pdf.security.* parameters listed in the section can be used for this purpose.
For example, to permit only the users having a password to access the document, and also restricting their printing and copying capability you can use the following parameter combination:

strow.stentry: People using this password will be able to open the document, with full permissions.
People using this password will be able to open the document, but they will not be able to print.

body.note: If you specify just the user password (without an owner password) then the people using it will be considered owners, and no restrictions will apply to them.
